content.question: What is the purpose of the LCMSampler-ComfyUI extension node?
content.answer: The LCMSampler-ComfyUI extension node is designed to use the LCMized LoRA of the [SSD-1B-anime](https://huggingface.co/furusu/SSD-1B-anime) model for generating images.

content.question: Is the performance of LCMSampler-ComfyUI guaranteed in the original LCM?
content.answer: No, the performance of LCMSampler-ComfyUI in the original LCM is not guaranteed, and the current version cannot load weights.

content.question: What is the recommended method to use the LCMSampler-ComfyUI?
content.answer: To use LCMSampler-ComfyUI, one should use a custom sampler-compatible loader instead of the usual KSampler. The sampler should be loaded from 'sampling/custom_sampling/Load SamplerLCM'.

content.question: How is TAESD used with LCMSampler-ComfyUI?
content.answer: TAESD is used as a decoder and can be loaded using 'loader/Load TAESD'. It is expected to function similarly to a VAE. If there is not enough VRAM, users should decrease the max_batch_size.

content.question: What resources are needed to be downloaded for LCMSampler-ComfyUI?
content.answer: To use LCMSampler-ComfyUI, users need to download a model checkpoint and two LoRA files from the provided links in the workflow description.

content.question: Where can the source code for Latent Consistency Model (LCM) be found?
content.answer: The source code for Latent Consistency Model (LCM) can be found at https://github.com/luosiallen/latent-consistency-model.

content.question: Which other extension is LCMSampler-ComfyUI based on?
content.answer: LCMSampler-ComfyUI is based on the ComfyUI-OtherVAEs extension, which can be found at https://github.com/M1kep/ComfyUI-OtherVAEs.
